alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following county, Taylor. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Perry, Steinhatchee, Athena, Pinland, Carbur, Blue Springs, Salem, Adams Beach, Dekle Beach, Jack Lee Island, Jug Island, Keaton Beach, Foley, Cedar Island, Bucell Junction, Fenholloway, Perry-Foley Airport, Bird Island, Fish Creek and Howell Place. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
